result.execSummary:
The defendant Ezra C Ladwig-Hendricks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ezra C Ladwig-Hendricks is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ezra C Ladwig-Hendricks was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Ezra C Ladwig-Hendricks was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Ezra C Ladwig-Hendricks was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea Diversion Agreement - Count 1
AMENDED

10:32 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by DA Christenson - defendant will plea to counts 1, 3 & 4.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over the maximum penalties.  Defendant will enter a plea of GUILTY.  State moves to dismiss the enhancer on count 1.  Court dismisses the enhancer on count 1.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1, strikes the place enhancer.  Court orders the sentence stayed pending compliance with the Plea Diversion Agreement - 2 years.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed.  Court finds the defendant Guilty to counts 3 & 4.   Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 3 & COUNT 4 - SWD, and placed on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:
-court costs
-Random urinalysis tests.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Get a high school diploma or equivalency

Court grants either party to request recusal and needs to be done within 48 hours.
